meanings.definition: The study or description of mountains.
meanings.sent1: In geography class, we learned about orographies and how they shape the Earth's surface.
meanings.sent2: The orographies of the Himalayas are fascinating to explore.
meanings.sent3: The orographies in the textbook made the students yawn with boredom.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for orographies was as high as the peaks she studied.
meanings.sent5: The vivid pictures of orographies in the magazine took my breath away.

meanings.definition: The physical features of a mountain range.
meanings.sent1: The orographies of the Rockies include towering peaks and deep valleys.
meanings.sent2: Hiking enthusiasts love to admire the orographies of different mountain ranges.
meanings.sent3: The artist painted the orographies with exaggerated colors for a playful effect.
meanings.sent4: The orographies of the Alps stood like ancient giants against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The guide pointed out the unique orographies of the landscape during the tour.

meanings.definition: The science of mountains and mountain ranges.
meanings.sent1: Studying orographies involves understanding the formation and erosion of mountains.
meanings.sent2: Experts in orographies predict the impact of climate change on mountain ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled when the teacher mentioned orographies in class.
meanings.sent4: His knowledge of orographies was as vast as the mountain ranges themselves.
meanings.sent5: The documentary showcased the beauty and complexity of orographies around the world.
